title: The One Without The Ski Trip

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Chandler and Joey are sitting on the couch reading.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Can I see the comics?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: This is the New York Times .

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Okay, may I see the comics?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Guys. I thought you were taking Ross to the game?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: We are. He’s meeting us here.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No! Rachel is meeting us here.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh come on, they can be in the same room.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, you shoulda been there last night.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Why? What happened now?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well Ross was hangin’ out over at our place, Rachel comes over to borrow some moisturiser from Chandler....

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah y-you, how hard is it to say something? Rachel came over to borrow something.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Anyway! Her and Ross just started yelling at each other.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Wait. Why was he yelling at her? He’s the one who slept with someone else.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, I guess he says that because they were on a break when it happened, that she should of forgiven him by now.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Whoa!! He is soo unreasonable! God, although I think I understand what he means. Oh my God, this is like 60 Minutes , okay, when, when, at first you’re really mad at that pharmaceutical company for making the drug and then y'know you just feel bad for the people because they needed to make their hair grow.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Y'know what this is like? This is like when my parents got divorced. Man, I hope Ross doesn’t try to kidnap me after Cub Scouts.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Y'know I had a dream where Ross and Rachel were still together, they never broke up. And we were all just like hanging out, and everyone was happy....

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I had the same dream!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, and nobody slept with that Xerox girl.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, I had the opposite dream.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Y'know what maybe it’s gonna be okay, I mean it’s been a week.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, I mean it’s never taken me a week to get over a relationship.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It’s never taken you more than a shower to get over a relationship.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (seeing her) Okay, let’s go!! Let’s hit the road!!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Let’s get the show on it!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, let me just get a cup of coffee.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh Rachel, I know the best coffee house and it’s sooo close.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Closer than here?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (turning around and picking a cup off of a table) Oh, hey, look, I found coffee! (handing her the cup) Okay, let’s skedaddle.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Wait, I’m not just gonna drink somebody’s old coffee.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, your highness.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (in a deep voice, imitating Ross) Um, Rachel I’m really sorry. (imitating Rachel) That’s okay, do you wanna get back together? (imitating Ross) Yeah, okay. (in her normal voice) Did anyone else hear that?!

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, the whole gang is there, except for Ross and Rachel. Joey
is trying to eat Chinese with chopsticks and fails miserably. There’s a knock on the
door, and Chandler answers it to reveal Rachel]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (softly) Is he here?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh. (smiles) Here’s your moisturiser. Hi!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA AND PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You guys are gonna love meee! Okay, check it out, Thursday night, five tickets, Calvin Klein lingerie show, and you guys are coming with me. (they’re all silent and look away) Okay, I said that out loud right?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, it’s just that we ah, we kinda all ready, made plans with Ross.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, well okay. Well, there you go.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, it’s just that he got this new like home theater dealie, and he wants y'know, us to check it out.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hm-mm.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, he’s really excited about it too, he even recorded show times on his answering machine.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ohh!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: We’re sorry honey.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, it’s okay. (starts to leave)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Rach, it’s, it’s ah, it’s not that we don’t want to, really. (quietly) Are we talking models in their underwear?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: And heels.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (He turns around to Chandler looking for approval to go with Rachel, Chandler mouths ‘Come on!’) (turning back to Rachel) Ross, did ask us first, and we set that night aside.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No, hey, come on, if he asked you first, that’s only fair. (leaves)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ohhh boy, do I feel bad.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh yeah.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Very bad.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Chandler what are you doing?!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Chandler!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (jumps back and points at the cigarette) Oh my God!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You’re smoking again?!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, actually, yesterday I was smoking again. Today, I’m, I’m smoking still.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Why would you start again after chewing all that quitting gum?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Look, I’m telling you this is just like my parents divorce, which is when I started smoking in the first place.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Weren’t you nine?!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeahhh. I’m tellin’ ya something, that ah, first smoke after nap time....

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh that’s great, with my luck, that’s gonna be him.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Him? Him, Ross?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Nope, hymn 253, His Eyes Are On The Sparrow! When my parents got divorced is when I started using humour as a defence mechanism. (answers the door and it’s Rachel again.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi! Uhh, do you guys have plans for the weekend? Because I have my sister on hold, and she said that we could use her cabin for the weekend and go skiing. Huh? I’m asking you first, right?!. I mean I’m playing by the rules.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Absolutely, yeah!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Chandler! You’re smoking? What are you doing?!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, shut up!! You’re not my real Mom!!

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Ross’s, the gang, minus Rachel of course, is there. Chandler is forced to
smoke by an open window.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (obviously cold) Hey, can you close that window Chandler? My nipples can cut glass over here!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Wait. Really?! ‘Cause mine get me out of tickets.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Look, you guys I just wanna say, I really, really appreciate you spending this time with me. It’s been a pretty hard time right now, so I just wanna say thanks.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Can somebody else hug him? I have to stay by the window.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh hey, hey, huh, how about this weekend we have a laser disc marathon okay, and maybe a tournament on my new dart board? Huh, huh, what do you think? (in an Irish accent) Two days of darts, it’ll be great!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: It’ll be great for next weekend.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, no, no, this weekend guys!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: It’ll be great for next weekend. I mean, (in an Irish accent) it’ll be grrreat.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What’s going on?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, we were um, sorta invited to go skiing, y'know Rachel’s sister’s cabin. (Chandler goes back to the window to smoke again.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: So, for the whole weekend?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: We’re really sorry, but um, she did ask us first.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, that’s okay, I mean if you guys all have to go away for the first weekend I’m alone by myself, y'know then I totally, totally understand.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Y'know what, I can stay, I’m gonna stay. ‘Cause the last time I went skiing I was to afraid to jump off the chair lift, I just went around and around.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Uh, Pheebs we kinda need you to drive us all up there in your grandmother’s cab, but y'know what, I’ll stay.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Noo! I’ll stay. He’s my brother.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What a pity stay?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No! We’re gonna have fun. We can make fudge!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Pity food? Y'know what that’s okay, all right, I don’t need any of you to stay, okay nobody stays.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, then, I might as well offer to stay.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: In Phoebe’s Grandmother’s cab, driving up to the cabin. Phoebe’s
driving, Rachel’s sitting shotgun, Chandler, Monica, and Joey are in the back seat.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (to Chandler and Monica) Hey, does anybody else feel bad about Ross?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why? Do you think he’s still mad at us?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Joey) Well he’s probably mad after you called him this morning to borrow his goggles.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What? Mine aren’t tinted.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Chandler!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What does the sign say?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Beam me up Jesus.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, the ‘No Smoking’ sign. There’s no smoking in my Grandmother’s cab.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, well, then, I-I have to go to the bathroom.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Oh!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Please!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No Chandler no! No unscheduled stops. You can go when we stop for gas.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, come on, there’s a rest stop right up there! Come on, I really have to goooooooooo.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, now I have to go!!

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The rest stop, Phoebe’s pulling in.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Here we go. Okay, brace yourselves.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ow!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (to Rachel, who’s staying in the cab.) Aren’t you gonna go?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No. Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (getting out) No, Rachel never pees in public restrooms.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, they never have any paper in there y'know. So my rule is ‘no tissue, no tuschy.’ (Phoebe laughs and gets out.) Well, if everybody’s going. (She gets out and starts to close the door.)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, y'know what don’t close it (Rachel slams the door shut locking themselves out.) ‘cause the... keys...are in there.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, no-no-no-no-no-no!!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What’s going on?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Joey) My lighter’s in there! (points to the cab)

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The rest stop, the gang is still stuck, Chandler is kneeling at the rear
bumper.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Damn! (stands up) The tailpipe’s not hot enough to light this!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Relax okay, I-I-I can get this open. Anybody have a coat hanger?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh I do! Op, no, wait a minute, I took it out of my shirt when I put it on this morning.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So, if you’re parents hadn’t got divorced, you’d be able to answer a question like a normal person?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Look, I just need a wire something to jimmy it. Oh hey, one of you guys give me the underwire from your bra!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Come on! Who has the biggest boobs?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Please!!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Whoever has the biggest boobs, has the biggest bra, therefore has the biggest wire.

dialogue.speaker: THE GIRLS
dialogue.text: No, not getting my bra!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: If you wanna get back in the car, we need the wire, your call.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, Monica’s are the biggest.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: These tiny, little non-breasts?! Please, it’s gotta be Rachel.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What, no, no, no, mine are deceptively small I mean, I-I-I actually sometimes, st-stuff my bra.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All right then, your bra would still be big.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No, I stuff outside the bra.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ladies, ladies, let’s just compromise okay? Phoebe, Rachel take off Monica’s bra.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: All right, forget it, nevermind, you can have mine.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (seeing him) Chandler, what are you doing? There is a trash can right there.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, I thought if I littered, that crying Indian might come by and save us.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (finishing removing her bra) Okay, there.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Thank you Phoebe, that is very, very generous.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, now let’s decide who has the nicest ass.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (opening the door) And there you go!

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Oh, yeahhhhh!!!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Chandler!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: At least let me smoke it to the good part.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay. (The car moves a few feet and sputters to a stop.) Oh, no!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What, what’s it, what’s going on?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, this has happened before.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: So you know how to fix it?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yep. Put more gas in.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Carol and Susan’s, Carol is setting a romantic dinner for Susan as there
is a knock on the door.]

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: (answering the door) Hi!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Hey, what are you doing here?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, oh just ah, I was just wondering, when you and I split up, did you get the tape that was half the last episode of M*A*S*H and half the hostages coming home?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Ah yeah, but now it’s Susan and me in Mexico and the hostages coming home.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Where’s Ben?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: He’s sleeping.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ahh. (notices the table) Ooh, is this a ah, is this a bad time?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Umm, yeah, actually, Susan’s gonna be home any minute, it’s kinda an anniversary.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh! I thought you guys got married in uh, January?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: It’s not that kind of anniversary.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ah! (realises) Oh.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Sooo!! Anyway...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Umm, candles, champagne, yeah anniversaries are great. ‘Cause you know love lasts forever, y'know. Nothing like it in this lifetime, money in the bank, so Rachel and I broke up.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Oh God, Ross I am so sorry.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, well.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Y'know what, I want to talk to you about this so much, but we should probably do it when we could really get into it, are you free for dinner tomorrow night?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, I’d love that.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Oh, great! Me too.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I guess it all started when Rachel got this new job. (he sits down at the table.)

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The rest stop, Phoebe is on the phone to the motor club.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, yeah. (to Monica and Rachel) Triple A can pick us up.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Great!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, what town are we near?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Freemont. West-Westmont, ah Westburg?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (to Monica) Then why are you answering? Do you at least know what route we’re on?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, we are definitely on Route 27.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay. (on phone) We are at a rest stop on Route 27. Okay. (to Rachel) There is no Route 27. (listens) (to Rachel) Okay, either 93 or 76?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I don’t know, I’m sorry, I always slept in the back when we drove up here.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay. (on phone) Hey, can you send somebody up and down 76 and check every rest stop, and, and also 93? (listens) Okay! (hangs up) Yeah, no they don’t do that.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ugh, okay, well somebody will come and save us.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Who? I mean have you seen a car come by here in the last hour and a half? I think we should call Ross, maybe he can get a car and come pick us up.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No! No, I am not getting in a car with Ross, we will just have to live here!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: But if...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No you guys, I am not getting in a car with him, you’ll have to think of something else.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh good, oh Joey and Chandler are back.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So the going for help went well?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, Smokey Joe here got half way to the highway and collapsed.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I have the lung capacity of a two year old. (starts to light another cigarette.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Then why are you smoking?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well it’s very unsettling.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Carol and Susan’s, Ross is eating the dinner Carol made for Susan.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: ....right? Right? I mean it’s pretty unbelievable y'know, I mean they just took off, took off without even looking back. Y'know I don’t, I don’t need them, huh, I’ve got you guys now as friends, you and Susan.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Ah, Susan will be so pleased.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (looking at the page) 717? (to Carol) Where’s 717? (He gets up to return the page, Carol starts to take the last of the food into the kitchen, but Ross grabs the last piece.) Hey, you’ve have more of these for Susan right?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: No. But it’s okay, I’ll just put out pickles or something.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (answering the phone) (whispering) Ross, thank God.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Pheebs? What, why are you whispering?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I ate a bug.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (running over to stop Rachel) Hey Rach, the tampons here are only a penny. Let’s stock up. (takes her into the bathroom)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Listen Ross, we ran out of gas, and we don’t know where we are, so we can’t get a tow truck.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, now you want a favour?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yes, please.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, oh, I’m sorry your car broke down Pheebs, but I’m a little too busy with some of my real friends right now, but please call to let me know you got home safely okay?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: (running over and grabbing the phone away from Ross) (on phone) Phoebe, hang on a second. (Hands Ross her keys) Here, take my car, go pick up your friends.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, I’m not gonna pick them up.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Listen, we both know you’re gonna do it ‘cause you’re not a jerk. Okay? So you can either sulk here for a half hour and then go pick them up, or save us both time and sulk in the car.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, Rachel doesn’t want me to....

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Look, I-I-I am sorry that Rachel dumped you ‘cause she fell in love with that Mark guy, and you are the innocent victim in all of this, but don’t punish your friends for what Rachel did to you.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, you’re right.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: (on phone) Phoebe hang on a second Ross wants to say something. (listens) What? (listens) (to Ross) You slept with someone else?!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: We were on a break!!! Okay!! (grabs the phone) We were, we were..., (calms down) yeah. Where are you? I’ll find you. (hangs up)

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: You slept with another woman?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, you-you’re-you’re one to talk.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The rest stop, Joey is making a sign.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Okay, done.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (reading the sign) What’s ‘pleh’?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: That’s ‘help’ spelled backwards so that the helicopters can read it from the air!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Huh. What’s doofus spelled backwards?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (all excited) Op, op, car! Car!! (sees it’s Ross) Ugh!!!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, it’s Ross on one of his drives!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER AND JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey!!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hi!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What is he doing here?!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: He is saving your butt, ah, unless of course I’m stepping on some toes here, in which case I can just mosey on, I’ve got plenty of people to help on the Interstate.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: No! Come on!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: All right!! Fine! Fine.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Arrrghh!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh no, now it’s not gonna make any sense!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (to Chandler and Monica) You guys, what, what do we do about Ross who drove all the way up here? What do we do? Just like send him back and we’re then gonna go skiing?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, this is horrible, it’s just horrible.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Guys, do you think we should ask Ross to come along?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I know, what about Rachel? I mean how are we even gonna ask her?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ask me what?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Umm, if ah, it might be okay if Ross came skiing?

dialogue.speaker: AND JOEY
dialogue.text: No, I wasn’t gonna ask you that, no.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You guys are unbelievable. No! He cannot come.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Excuse me?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: It’s horrible.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (sarcastic) Oh please, can’t I come to your special, magical cabin?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Why would you even want to come Ross? You’re a horrible skier.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh-oh, hitting me where it hurts, my ski skills.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Here we go again.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I-I can’t handle this, you guys.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Y'know what, I can handle it, handle’s my middle name. Actually it’s the ah, middle part of my first name.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: All right Pheebs, your cab’s ready.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: All right, let’s go!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You’re welcome.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, I’m sorry, were you speaking to me or sleeping with someone else?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: We were on a break!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Y'know Ross why don’t you put that on your answering machine!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey-hey, it’s valid okay? And I’m not the only one who thinks so, Monica agrees with me.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (to Monica) What?!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (shyly) I don’t know.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That’s what you said last night.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What I said was, was that I understood. Joey’s the one who agreed with you!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Really Joey?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (pause) What?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Y'know what, but there is, there is no right or wrong, here.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No, I think it’s very obvious who’s wrong here.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Obviously not to Joey.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (pause) What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to Rachel) Look both, Joey and Monica feel the same way that I do. No-no-no-no.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Guys, guys, guess who I am?! (starts dancing around in an effort to stop the fighting.)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey! Hey! Hey! Hey!! Hey!!! (they all stop fighting, Chandler continues to dance.) Look what you’re doing to Chandler!! (Chandler finally stops) (to Ross and Rachel) Yeah, look, we know this is really, really hard for you guys. Okay? (Ross starts to leave) You don’t, all right you don’t have to love each other, okay? You don’t, you don’t even have to like each other much right now. But please, you have to figure out a way to be around each other.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, and not put us in the middle.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, otherwise, I mean that’s, that’s, that’s just it for us hanging out together. Y'know is that what you want? (they both look away) Can you be civil?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I can.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay. Good, all right, let’s get back in the car, ‘cause it’s freezing, and my chest is unsupported.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh what, wait, wait a second, I mean, what are we doing? Who’s going with who?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Look, you guys, you guys should go. (Joey tries to say something, but Ross cuts him off.) No, I’m, you, you planned this all out, and I don’t want to ruin it, so you guys should just go.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Come on man, you drove all the way up here.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, no, really, I’ve got to take the car back anyway, I’m spending all day tomorrow with Ben, It’s fine, no guilt I promise.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All right, we’ll call you when we get back.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Maybe we can like go to a movie or something.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Or, or the rodeo!!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That would be great.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I was being Shelly Winters from The Poseidon Adventure .

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I know!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Bye!!!

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Carol and Susan’s, Carol is running to answer the door.]

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: (looking through the peephole) Ugh. (opening the door) Ross!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (entering) Hi! Sorry I’m late. Were you sleeping?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Ahh, nooo!!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, great! Listen, oh I had to get you a whole new battery. I got you the best one I could, ‘cause that’s not where you want to skimp.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: You’re a genius, Ross.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, well it came to about $112, but what the hell, just call it an even 110?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Okay, I’ll pay you tomorrow. (pushes him out the door)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Okay, bye!!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: So they ah, they all took off, it was pretty hard watching them go, y'know?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Yeah, okay, bye. (closes the door, turns out the lights, and runs back to the bedroom)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (outside the door) So I’m gonna take off then!
